bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to John J. Moran, December 21, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison sends Moran a photograph and requests that he autograph it for Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to John J. Moran, December 21, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
December 21, 1940

div1.p:
Since we wrote you asking for a portrait we
have succeeded in getting a copy from our photographer.
We are sending it to you immediately. If you have
sent a copy of your portrait autographed to Doctor
Hench, please keep this for an extra or use it in any
way you choose. If, on the other hand, you have had
difficulty in securing a portrait or have not done so
for any reason just drop that. In that case kindly
autograph this with your signature and with regards to
Doctor Hench or whatever you wish to put on it. Kindly
mail it back to us, not to Doctor Hench.

We hope everything is going well and that you
have a very Merry Christmas.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Ralph Cooper Hutchison Mr. John J. Moran
